title: Nine suspected Isis members escape from camp in Syria amid Turkish offensive, France says
text:
Nine French women suspected of Isis membership have escaped from a Kurdish-controlled camp in Syria, France's foreign minister has said.

The news comes just days after hundreds of foreign Isis suspects escaped from a camp in Ain Issa, as Kurdish guards left their posts to flee a Turkish offensive.

It was not immediately clear which camp the French women escaped from.

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

Jean-Yves Le Drian told BFM TV that he would soon go to Iraq to discuss a judicial framework to enable jihadists being held in Syria to face trial.

More follows…
description: Nine French women suspected of Isis membership have escaped from a Kurdish-controlled camp in Syria, France's foreign minister has said.  The news comes just days after hundreds of foreign Isis suspects escaped from a camp in Ain Issa, as Kurdish guards left their posts to flee a Turkish offensive.  It was not immediately clear which camp the French women escaped from.
